articles.title: New Year's Concert by Unhasu Orchestra Goes on
articles.content:
New Year's Concert by Unhasu Orchestra Goes on
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- 2012 New Year's concert "The Cause of the Sun Will Be Immortal" by the Unhasu Orchestra is going on at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre.
					Enjoying the concert on Saturday were officials of ministries and national institutions and working people in the city.
					
					The concert began with female trio and chorus "Cantata to Comrade Kim Jong Il".
					
					When the hymn in praise of the great man vibrated as a song for the memory of him and a song of best wishes for his immortality, the concert hall turned into a sea of tears.
					
					The numbers of the concert included chorus "His Life", male duet and male pangchang "We Long for You, General", chorus "Song of Love for People" and female solo and chorus "Oh, We Long for You".
					
					The performers sang of the undying feats of leader Kim Jong Il who protected the blue sky of the DPRK, holding high the banner of Songun and ushered in a new history of prosperity with the flames of great surge.
					
					Also touching the audiences were numbers that represented happiness provided under the loving care of the father.
					
					Choruses "On the Path of Struggle under the Leadership of the General" and "Our March" vividly showed the firm will of the Korean army and people to glorify the cause of perpetuating the memory of the leader through generations.
					
					The concert reached its climax with chorus "Might of Korea", which shows the faith and will of the Korean army and people to make to the last the Korean revolution started on Mt. Paektu, female trio and chorus "Under the Guidance of the Leader" and narrative and orchestral music "Korea Has Risen Up".
					
					The concert redoubled the resolute readiness and faith of certain victory of the audiences to devote their all to the struggle for prosperity of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea, singing loudly the song of revolution provided by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the dawn of the New Year's day.

articles.title: Year of Worsened Social Inequality and Contradictions for Capitalist World
articles.content:
Year of Worsened Social Inequality and Contradictions for Capitalist World
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- Last year witnessed worsened social inequality and contradictions in the capitalist world.
					An average of 411 500 people were registered as new unemployed in every week of October last year in the U.S.
					
					The U.S. Labor Department quoted a survey as saying the number of jobless people across the country stood at 13.3 million as of early in November.
					
					Japan had 2.92 million unemployed and EU member countries 23.554 million toiling people jobless as of October last year.
					
					The deepening unemployment crisis brought pain and poverty to the majority of toiling masses.
					
					Early in November last year, the Census Bureau of the U.S. announced that the number of the poverty-stricken people reached 49.1 million. The needy people of them were about 20 million. 
					
					More than 12.6 million and 8 million people are spending every day in despair and pain below the poverty line in Germany and Italy.
					
					The horrible crimes committed in the capitalist world last year brought deep-rooted social contradictions and antagonism into bolder relief. 
					
					The hideous crime that happened in a city of Belgium on December 13 clearly showed the reality of the capitalist world which saw in and out a year amid social evils.
					
					The waves of demonstrations which swept the capitalist countries were an eruption of the people's anger at the worsening social contradictions as evidenced by the jobless rate growing due to the deepening economic crisis and the widening gap between the rich and poor.
					
					People from all walks of life in the capitalist countries are still on sit-in strikes in tents in plazas and parks in cold, becoming increasingly critical of social inequality festering due to the limitless greed of the capitalists.
					
					As the protest of the popular masses gained momentum, police in different parts of the U.S. rushed to brutally suppress the anti- capitalism demonstrations. 
					
					They removed all the tents of the demonstrators, while indiscriminately arresting protestors. 
					
					This goes to clearly prove that the "freedom of speech" and "freedom of demonstration and assembly" touted by the capitalist countries are no more than hypocrisy.
					
					Social contradictions and antagonism are the incurable diseases of the capitalist system. Due to this malignant cancer, the capitalist world is plunging deeper into a bottomless abyss of ruin day by day.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Unethical Crimes Slammed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Unethical Crimes Slammed
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- Pu Yong Uk, chairman of the Osaka Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, issued a statement on Jan. 6 denouncing the south Korean group of traitors for their unethical crimes committed during the nation's mourning over the great loss. 
					The statement blasted the Lee group for rubbing salt into the wounds of the compatriots grieving over the great loss to the nation in pursuit of a foolish aim.
					
					The group of traitors is a rude gang of hooligans who know nothing about the nation and ethics and morality and human scum, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					It is the unanimous view of all Koreans that the Lee group of traitors should not be allowed to stay in power any longer as they are engrossed in unpopular acts and treachery, hell-bent on confrontation with compatriots.
					
					The statement called for launching a dynamic nation-wide struggle to throw overbroad the heinous group of traitors and make a breakthrough towards independent reunification this year under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Establishment of National Reconciliation-oriented Government Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Establishment of National Reconciliation-oriented Government Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- Thongil News, an internet paper of south Korea, issued a New Year article titled "Let us set up national reconciliation-oriented government" on Jan. 1.
					The article recalled that after its emergence the Lee Myung Bak "government" trampled down on democracy and put the people's livelihood into deterioration, totally denied the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and strained the south-north relations, increasing the danger of war. 
					
					The "government" finally paid no heed to the voices of the people calling for rolling back the policy of escalating the confrontation with compatriots and terminating the unequal "alliance" with the U.S., the article noted, and went on:
					
					The past history clearly proves that when the "government" pursuing confrontation with compatriots emerges in south Korea, the south-north relations are bound to deteriorate and a war crisis to loom.
					
					2012 is the year for settling accounts with the Lee Myung Bak "government", the article notes, calling for judging the "government" of traitors and not allowing the forces who have exercised all powers under its patronage to raise their heads.
					
					The article underscored the need for the progressive forces supporting the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration to emerge victorious in the "National Assembly" and "presidential" elections to be held this year and set up a government aspiring after national reconciliation and reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Quelling Voices Praising Great Men
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Quelling Voices Praising Great Men
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is busy investigating the South Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), according to CBS of south Korea on Jan. 7.
					The South Headquarters of Pomminryon developed a program for phone conversation praising the peerless great men, fascinated by the personality of leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un as great men.
					
					The program is giving momentum to the enthusiasm of the south Korean people to praise the great men.
					
					Much upset by this, police are busy with investigation and frantic suppression on charges of violation of the ill-famed "National Security Law."

articles.title: Projected U.S. Air Force War Exercises in S. Korea
articles.content:
Projected U.S. Air Force War Exercises in S. Korea
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea announced that they would stage a night flight training in the U.S. Air Force base in Kunsan from Jan. 7 to 9, south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					The U.S. imperialist warmongers are contemplating staging provocative war maneuvers for a surprised preemptive attack on the DPRK under cover of darkness.
					
					The U.S. imperialists recently set forth a new military strategy to concentrate their war capability on Asia. On this basis they are busy staging exercises for preemptive attack on the DPRK in a bid to implement it, while fanning up the hysteria of the puppet forces for invading it.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial of DPRK Supported in Different Countries
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial of DPRK Supported in Different Countries
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations in different countries released statements in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.
					The National Salvation Front of Russia in its statement on Jan. 2 supported the DPRK's militant programme laid down in the joint editorial and expressed solidarity with the Korean people in their efforts to carry out the great historic tasks.
					
					On the same day the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea in its statement expressed belief that the Korean people who have the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the helm of the revolution would surely emerge victorious in the drive for carrying out the tasks set forth in the joint editorial this year and implementing the last instructions for national reunification of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The France-Korea Friendship Association in its statement on Jan. 1 expressed support to the joint New Year editorial and stressed that it would launch a widespread signature campaign demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea and the conclusion of a peace treaty for peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, and Than Tun, general director for Administrative Affairs of the Union of Myanmar Economic Holdings Limited, also released statements on Jan. 1 and 2 in support of the joint editorial.

articles.title: Stamp Exhibition and Memorial Service for Kim Jong Il Held in China
articles.content:
Stamp Exhibition and Memorial Service for Kim Jong Il Held in China
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- A stamp exhibition and memorial service on the theme of "The respected General Kim Jong Il will live forever" took place in Beijing on Dec. 29 last year.
					On display there were stamps showing leader Kim Jong Il standing together with President Kim Il Sung, dealing with the birth of Kim Jong Il, his start of work at the C. C., Workers' Party of Korea, a series of his visits to China, the exploits performed by him for national reunification and others.
					
					The participants observed three minutes' silence in memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Zu Zuwei, chairperson of the Beijing Gulou Philatelic Research Society of China who doubles as chairperson of the Sino-DPRK Stamp Research Society, recalled that since the foundation of the Sino-DPRK Stamp Research Society on February 16, 1999 it has contributed to the development of the Sino-DPRK friendly relations through the exchange of stamps thanks to the deep care and great benevolence of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Expressing sorrow over the demise of Kim Jong Il, close friend of the Chinese people, Zu Zuwei said the society would always hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as its honorary chairman.
					
					Chinese philatelists would hand down forever the immortal exploits Kim Jong Il performed for the Korean revolution and the development of the Sino-DPRK friendship and his great loving care shown for the society, the chairperson stressed.

articles.title: DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Published by Bangladeshi and S. African Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Published by Bangladeshi and S. African Organizations
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- "Glorify This Year 2012 as a Year of Proud Victory, a Year When an Era of Prosperity Is Unfolding, True to the Instructions of the Great General Kim Jong Il", the joint New Year editorial of Rodong Sinmun, Joson Inmingun and Chongnyon Jonwi, was brought out in bulletin by the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee and the South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People on January 1.

articles.title: U.S. Preparations for War of Aggression against DPRK Disclosed by Japanese Paper
articles.content:
U.S. Preparations for War of Aggression against DPRK Disclosed by Japanese Paper
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Mainichi Shimbun disclosed the fact that the U.S. has frantically stepped up the preparations for invading the DPRK with Japan as a base.
					The paper reported on Jan. 5 that the U.S. navy designated 6 civilian ports in Japan as the ports to be used in "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					Recalling that U.S. warships are entering those ports regularly at present, the paper said though the U.S. navy claims these portcalls are for "amity and friendship", they are, in fact, aimed at making field survey of the ports.

articles.title: Work to Bolster Strategic Rocket Forces Makes Progress in Russia
articles.content:
Work to Bolster Strategic Rocket Forces Makes Progress in Russia
Moscow, January 7 (KCNA) -- Russia is making sustained great efforts for bolstering its strategic rocket forces.
					A spokesman for the Strategic Rocket Forces of Russia said on Jan. 5 that the work would be completed to reequip the Tatsishebo Missile Division of the SRF with the stationary Topol-M missile complex within this year.
					
					This will bring the task for reequipping the SRF with Topol-M missile complex to completion, he noted.

articles.title: Iran Calls for Islamic Awakening Movement against Plots of US and Israel
articles.content:
Iran Calls for Islamic Awakening Movement against Plots of U.S. and Israel
Tehran, January 7 (KCNA) -- Secretary of the Supreme National Security Council Saeed Jalili, in a meeting with Turkish Foreign Minister Ahmet Davutoglu on Thursday, called for awareness of Islamic countries in dealing with the plots of the U.S. and the Israel.
					Following current developments in the region, the US is now striving to make good on the setbacks of the Zionist regime by changing the balance of power to the benefit of the Zionists, he said.
					
					Islamic states should be vigilant in dealing with the plots of their enemies and make use of their potentials in their struggles against the U.S. and Zionist regime, he said.

articles.title: Indonesia's Palm Oil Exports Forecast to Rise in 2012
articles.content:
Indonesia's Palm Oil Exports Forecast to Rise in 2012
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- Indonesian palm oil producer association (GAPKI) predicts the country's palm oil exports is going to rise this year as production and global demand increases, local media reported Wednesday.
					The association expected the exports were going to increase from 17.5 million tons to 18 million tons this year from last year's expectation of 16.5 million tons.

articles.title: Earthquakes Hit Different Countries
articles.content:
Earthquakes Hit Different Countries
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- An earthquake with the magnitude of 5.1 jolted Gorontalo of Indonesia earlier Thursday.
					The quake struck at 08:19 a.m. Jakarta time (0119 GMT) with the epicenter at 94 km southwest Gorontalo city of Gorontalo Province and with the depth of 43 km.
					
					On the same day, a 5.3-magnitude earthquake hit the Dominican Republic and a 5-magnitude earthquake jolted southern Iran.

articles.title: Serious Joblessness in U.S.
articles.content:
Serious Joblessness in U.S.
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- The issue of unemployment still remains serious in the U.S. due to economic and financial crises.
					The number of Americans initially applying for unemployment aid in the week ending Dec. 31 was 372 000, the Labor Department reported Thursday.

articles.title: Mexican President Calls on His People to Turn out in Building of New Society
articles.content:
Mexican President Calls on His People to Turn out in Building of New Society
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- Mexican President Felipe Calderon Hinojosa in a New Year's address referred to the tasks facing the government this year.
					Noting that this year the government would continue to intensify the combat against crimes by mobilizing every means and method, he called upon the police and members of the law-abiding institutions to sincerely implement their duties for the security of the people.
					
					The government will strive to let all inhabitants receive social benefits, create more jobs and provide them with good living conditions, he noted.
					
					Greeting the New Year 2012, he called upon all of them to turn out in the building of a better state full of fresh enthusiasm and confidence with hope for the future.

articles.title: Brazen-faced GI Criminal's Appeal under Fire
articles.content:
Brazen-faced GI Criminal's Appeal under Fire
Pyongyang, January 8 (KCNA) -- The Joint Conference for Settling GIs' Crimes of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Jan. 5 at which it denounced the appeal made by a shameless GI criminal.
					The organization at the conference recalled that a trial on the appeal made by the GI criminal who committed a sexual assault against a young girl student in Tongduchon, Kyonggi Province was to take place on the same day.
					
					As already known, a GI belonging to the Second Division of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces present in south Korea committed a sexual assault against an 18-year old girl student in Tongduchon, Kyonggi Province on Sept. 24 last year.
					
					When the south Korean court authorities sentenced him to imprisonment in face of strong protests by people of various circles, he shamelessly made an appeal under the pretence that punishment was too heavy.
					
					The organization declared that his mean behavior hell-bent on evading punishment, far from admitting his crime is touching off people's anger.
					
					Quite many crimes are reported from among GIs in south Korea, but they remain unsettled, the organization deplored.
					
					Saying that the issue of GI crimes can never be solved unless the U.S. forces change their cognition and attitude of not regarding such crimes as robbery, violence and rape as serious in south Korea, the organization urged the court to make a right decision.
					
					It demanded that the U.S. forces take a fundamental measure for eradicating their crimes and totally revise the humiliating south Korea-U.S. SOFA.
					
					Meanwhile, on the same day the GI criminal was so shameless as to appeal for reducing the sentence at the High Court, triggering off anger of people of various circles in south Korea.
